request.description: Object containing information about the request.

llm_type.description: Specifies the nature of the interaction with the model. A 'chat' type indicates a conversational approach, potentially involving multiple exchanges, and is structured to facilitate ongoing interaction. In contrast, a 'completion' type represents a direct response to a specific prompt, often used to generate text based on the initial input, without the context of a back-and-forth conversation. The structure of both the request and response will vary accordingly.

provider.description: Provider of the AI model, e.g., OpenAI.

prompt.description: The initial text input provided to the AI, prompting it to generate a response. This is used only for 'completion' requests.

max_tokens.description: Maximum tokens for the AI model response.

temperature.description: Temperature setting for the AI model.

top_p.description: Top P setting for the AI model.

stream.description: Whether to stream the response or not.

stop.description: Stop sequence for the AI model.

presence_penalty.description: Penalty for presence in the AI model response.

frequency_penalty.description: Penalty for frequency in the AI model response.

logprobs.description: Log probabilities setting for the AI model.

best_of.description: Best of setting for the AI model.

logit_bias.description: Bias in logits for the AI model.

messages.description: Used in 'chat' interactions, this field holds the conversation's content, structured as either a single message or an array of sequential messages, adapting to the flow of the conversation.

function_call.description: Object containing information about a function call within the message, if applicable.

name.description: Specifies a function called within the message, if applicable.

arguments.description: Arguments used in the function call, if any, within the message.

response.description: Object containing information about the response.

completions.description: Text generated by the model in response to a prompt. Used exclusively for 'completion' requests, this may include multiple iterations based on the same prompt, facilitating the selection of the most suitable output.

message.description: Used in 'chat' interactions, this field holds the conversation's content, structured as either a single message or an array of sequential messages, adapting to the flow of the conversation.

function_call.description: Object containing information about a function call within the message, if applicable.

name.description: Specifies a function called within the message, if applicable.

arguments.description: Arguments used in the function call, if any, within the message.

error.description: Object containing information about any error that occurred during the request.

code.description: An error code representing the type of error.

message.description: The error message, providing details of the error that occurred.
